div.p: Please click for information regarding the coronavirus (COVID-19).
Distance Learning For All is ready for our students! Please click here for the information you’ll need to begin digital learning on Monday, April 13.
Students will need to log in to their Schoology account in order to access the Distance Learning being provided by their teachers. Please follow these steps to log in to Schoology:

If you do not have a device at home (laptop, Chromebook, iPad, etc.), and you need to request a device for your student to use for Distance Learning, please click the link below and fill out the form.
We are currently setting appointments to pick up devices.
If you need help with interpretation, please click your language below:

Reynolds School District staff is dedicated to the academic success of our students. While our schools are closed, the district will make every effort to ensure that our students’ education is supported while at home.
Español • русский • Tiếng Việt • عرب

FOOD FOR STUDENTS
Reynolds School District will be offering meals for all students and their families ages 18 and under at the sites listed below. Meals will be distributed Monday-Friday from 11:30am to 1:00pm. Meals will be provided for curbside pick-up (in cars or on foot) or in the parking lot.
April 1-28 • Monday-Friday • 11:30am-1:00pm

div.div:
4/3/2020 UPDATE: SIA Application Public Review and Comment
The Student Investment Account (SIA) Application is available for public review and comment. The Board will review the SIA Application and vote to approve at the April 8, 2020 School Board Work Session.
NOTE: This meeting will be held via virutal meeting due to COVID-19 and social distancing measures. The Work Session will begin at 7pm on Wednesday, April 8. You can join the meeting HERE.

div.p: Reynolds School District has partnered with the Center for Educational Effectiveness (CEE) to provide surveys to all families with students in Reynolds Schools, students in grades 4–12, and school staff members. The surveys will be active March 9–April 3, 2020.

div.div:
→ EN ESPAÑOL
→ на русском
***APPLICATIONS FOR THE 2019-20 SCHOOL YEAR ARE CLOSED***
Applications for the 2020-2021 school year will be open March 1–April 30, 2020 and July 1–31, 2020.

div.p: We want Reynolds School District to be an inclusive, positive environment, where you know you make a difference and your voice is heard.

That’s why we offer Let’s Talk!, an innovative customer service solution that allows parents, students, employees, and community members to be a part of critical school and district discussions. With Let’s Talk!, you can ask questions or submit comments whenever it’s convenient — 24 hours a day, seven days a week.

Attendance matters for students at all grade levels! Students who attend school regularly have a better chance of building a strong foundation as they move from preschool/kindergarten to high school, and are more likely to read at grade level. Children who are reading at grade level by the end of third grade are more likely to graduate on time.
In the event of an emergency, schools may need to close, delay the start of school or release students early.

Reynolds School District is currently in the process of developing a Strategic Plan for the next five years. We have various sessions to give input to the Strategic Plan Steering Committee during this process and will be including Student Success Act input!

div.p: Non-Discrimination Notice: Reynolds School District recognizes the diversity and worth of all individuals and groups in our society. It is the policy of the Reynolds School District Board of Education that all educational programs, activities and employment will be free of discrimination or harassment on the basis of race, color, religion, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, parental or marital status, or age. Contacts:

Title IX (staff), Equal Opportunity, Title VII, and American Disabilities Act: Jennifer Ellis, Executive Director of Human Capital Management (503) 661-7200 x3418
Title IX (students) and Section 504: Executive Director of Student & Family Services (503) 661-7200
Title IX (athletics): Chris Coleman, Athletic Director (503) 667-3186 x1008
